Docs.summary: The base class for all simple types and complex types.

remarks.format: ## Examples See the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSimpleType> class and the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaComplexType> class for an example using this class.

Docs.summary: Gets the post-compilation object type or the built-in XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) data type, simpleType element, or complexType element. This is a post-schema-compilation infoset property.
Docs.value: The built-in XSD data type, simpleType element, or complexType element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The complexType is derived from the type specified by the base value. The base value must be a QName.
> [!IMPORTANT] > The <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaType.BaseSchemaType%2A> property is obsolete and has been replaced by the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaType.BaseXmlSchemaType%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets the post-compilation value for the base type of this schema type.
Docs.value: An object representing the base type of this schema type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaType.BaseXmlSchemaType%2A> property always has a value, because all schema types have a base type. This value is set upon schema compilation, making it a part of the post-schema-compilation infoset.

get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the post-compilation information on how this element was derived from its base type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table shows the values that this property can contain.
|<xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod> value|Description| |----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod.None>|No derivation method specified.| |<xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod.Substitution>|Derived by Substitution.| |<xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod.Extension>|Derived by Extension.| |<xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod.Restriction>|Derived by Restriction.| |<xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod.List>|Derived by List.| |<xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod.Union>|Derived by Union.|

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Xml::Schema::XmlSchemaDerivationMethod Final { System::Xml::Schema::XmlSchemaDerivationMethod get(); void set(System::Xml::Schema::XmlSchemaDerivationMethod value); };

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.DefaultValue(Mono.Cecil.CustomAttributeArgument)
System.Xml.Serialization.XmlAttribute("final")
get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")
set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the final attribute of the type derivation that indicates if further derivations are allowed.
Docs.value: One of the valid values. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table shows the values that this property can contain for simple type.
|<xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod> value|Description| |----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod.Empty>|Overrides the schema `blockDefault` setting allowing any derivations by restriction, extension, or substitution to take place.| |<xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod.None>|No derivation method is specified. This is the default. Derivation rules are taken from the schema blockDefault setting.| |<xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod.Substitution>|Cannot be replaced by a type derived by Substitution.| |<xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod.Extension>|Cannot be replaced by a type derived by Extension.| |<xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod.Restriction>|Cannot be replaced by a type derived by Restriction.| |<xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod.All>|`#all`. Cannot be replaced by a type derived by any derivation method.|
The following table shows the values that this property can contain for complex type.
|<xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod> value|Description| |----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod.Empty>|Overrides the schema `blockDefault` setting allowing any derivations by restriction, extension, or substitution to take place.| |<xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod.None>|No derivation method is specified. This is the default. Derivation rules are taken from the schema `blockDefault` setting.| |<xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod.Substitution>|Cannot be replaced by a type derived by Substitution.| |<xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod.Extension>|Cannot be replaced by a type derived by Extension.| |<xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod.Restriction>|Cannot be replaced by a type derived by Restriction.| |<xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod.All>|`#all`. Cannot be replaced by a type derived by any derivation method.|

Docs.summary: Gets the post-compilation value of the property.
Docs.value: The post-compilation value of the property. The default is the attribute value of the element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This value indicates how the type is restricted when the type is extended through restriction. If the type is marked as `final`, this type cannot be extended.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSimpleType GetBuiltInSimpleType(valuetype System.Xml.Schema.XmlTypeCode typeCode) cil managed
Public Shared Function GetBuiltInSimpleType (typeCode As XmlTypeCode) As XmlSchemaSimpleType

Docs.param: One of the values representing the simple type.
Docs.summary: Returns an that represents the built-in simple type of the specified simple type.
Docs.returns: The that represents the built-in simple type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You cannot directly serialize the built-in type. If you need to serialize the type, create a new simple type which derives from the built-in type and serialize the simple type.
## Examples The following example shows how to create the type and add it to the schema.
[!code-csharp[XmlSchemaType#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/xmlschematype/cs/xmlschematype.cs#1)] [!code-vb[XmlSchemaType#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/xmlschematype/vb/getbuiltinsimpletype.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if this type has a mixed content model. This property is only valid in a complex type.
Docs.value: if the type has a mixed content model; otherwise, . The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The name must be an no-colon name (NCName) as defined in the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) XML Namespaces specification. If specified, the name must be unique among all `simpleType` and `complexType` elements.
